title: Quiz 2: Teaching & Learning Processes
topicName: Health Education Unit Five: Teaching and Learning Methodologies
description: Evaluate your knowledge of traditional vs. innovative teaching processes, lesson planning, and micro-teaching skills.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a 'Lesson Plan' in the teaching process?

options.text: To serve as a strict script that must be read word-for-word
To guide the systematic presentation of subject matter in a logical way
To record student attendance and grades
To replace the course curriculum entirely

questions.explanation: A lesson plan is a roadmap that ensures content is presented logically, sequentially, and effectively to reinforce learning.
questions.hint: It's a guide for the teacher's presentation.

questions.question: Which of the following are recognized 'Micro Teaching Skills' used to effective content delivery? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The six key micro-teaching skills are: Set Induction, Stimulus Variation, Reinforcement, Questioning, Use of Examples, and Closure.
questions.hint: Think about techniques to start, keep interest, reward, and end a lesson.

questions.question: Arrange the phases of the 'Three Step PBL Tutorial (ABC) Process' in the correct sequence:

items.text: Tutorial 1: Analysis, definition, and setting learning objectives
Tutorial 2: Presentation, problem solution, and synthesis

questions.explanation: PBL starts with problem analysis (Tut 1), moves to independent research (SDL), and concludes with synthesis and reporting (Tut 2).
questions.hint: Identify the problem -> Go find answers -> Come back and share.

questions.question: The innovative teaching skill acronym 'FAGIPW' stands for Facilitating, Assessing, Group dynamic maintenance, ___BLANK___, Planning, and Working as a ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: FAGIPW: Facilitating, Assessing, Group dynamic maintenance, Informing, Planning, Working as a role model.
questions.hint: The first is giving info; the second is leading by example.

questions.question: In 'Traditional' teaching processes, the emphasis is primarily on the learner taking responsibility, whereas in 'Innovative' processes, the teacher is the sole source of knowledge.
questions.explanation: It is the OPPOSITE. Traditional teaching emphasizes the teacher (didactic), while Innovative teaching (like PBL) shifts responsibility to the learner (facilitative).
questions.hint: Think about who does the 'work' in a lecture vs. a PBL group.

questions.question: Which micro-teaching skill involves varying movements, gestures, voice patterns, and sensory focus to maintain student attention?
questions.explanation: Stimulus Variation is the art of changing the sensory inputs (sight, sound, movement) to prevent boredom and keep learners alert.
questions.hint: It's about varying the 'stimuli' for the students.

questions.question: In the context of the Fifteen Step PBL process, what major activity happens during the 'Second SDL Period'?
questions.explanation: During the second SDL period (Step 13), students engage in further information gathering specifically on difficult objectives identified in the second tutorial.
questions.hint: What do students do when they are NOT in the tutorial room?

questions.question: Match the PBL Step with its description (based on the 7-Step Process):
questions.explanation: Step 1: Clarify terms; Step 2: Define problem; Step 5: Set objectives; Step 7: Synthesize findings.
questions.hint: First you understand the words, then the problem... objectives come before research.

questions.question: What is the key difference between 'Set Induction' and 'Closure' in a lesson?

richContent.content:
Teacher A: Starts by showing a shocking picture of a disease.

Teacher B: Ends by asking students to summarize the main points learned.

options.text: Set Induction is for ending a lesson; Closure is for starting.
Set Induction introduces the topic to capture attention; Closure helps consolidate and remember what was learned.
Both are used in the middle of the lesson.
Set Induction uses questions; Closure uses lectures.

questions.explanation: Set Induction 'sets the stage' at the beginning. Closure 'closes the loop' at the end to ensure retention.

questions.question: Which of the following roles are expected of a STUDENT in a Problem Based Learning (PBL) tutorial? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Wait for the tutor to provide all answers

questions.explanation: PBL students must be active, take on leadership roles, and evaluate the process. They are responsible for their own learning.
